text: Marina Ivanova-Kharlamova (; born 24 May 1962) is a Russian former Soviet track and field sprinter. She set 400 metres personal bests of 50.63 seconds outdoors and 52.23 seconds indoors.Marina KHARLAMOVA. All-Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-24. She was the national champion at the Soviet Indoor Athletics Championships in 1989.Soviet Indoor Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-24. She won bronze medals with the Soviet Union women's 4 × 400 metres relay team at the 1983 World Championships in Athletics (with Yelena Korban, Irina Baskakova and Mariya Pinigina) and at the 1979 European Athletics Junior Championships (with Lyubov Kiryukhina, Aldona Mendzoryte and Liliya Tuznikova). World Championships in Athletics. Mujeres Rapidos. Retrieved on 2016-08-24.European Junior Championships 1979. World Junior Athletics History.
